gurmukhi: qbih kiRSn soaU kIE jo bHmw isK dIn ]ieMdR sUr sB rudR bs jmih bol kir lIn ]1542]
transliteration: Tabah(i) Krishan Sooo Keeo Jo Brahmaa Sikh Deen Indra Soor Sabh Rudraa Has Jamah(i) Bol Kar(i) Leen||1542||
translation: Then as told by Brahma, Krishna did all that; he called all Indra, Surya, Rudra and Yamas.1542.

gurmukhi: inkit sXwm ky qb sB Awey ]kRoD hoie mn ju`Dih Dwey ]ieq sB iml kY ju`D mcwXo ]auq Ap`Crw nB Jr lwXo ]1543]
transliteration: Nikattee Syaam Ke Tab Sabh Aae|| Krodh Hoe Man Juddhah(i) Dhaae|| It Sabh Mil Kai Juddh Machadyo|| Out Apachchhraa Nabh Jhar Laayo||1543||
translation: Then all came to Krishna and getting enraged marched away for war; on this side they began to wage war and on the other side, the heavenly damsels began to dance in the sky.1543.

gurmukhi: kY kY ktwC ncY qyau Bwmn gIq sBY iml kY sur gwvY ]bIn pKwvj qwl bjY fP BwNiq Anykn Bwau idKwvY ]
transliteration: Kai Kai Kataachh Nachai Teo Bhaamanndgeet Sabhai Mil Kai Sur Gadvai|| Been Pakhaavaj Taal Bajai Daph Bhaant(i) Anekan Bhaao Dikhaavai||
translation: Throwing their side-glances, the beautiful young damsels began to dance and sing in melodious voices; playing on the lyres, drums and tabors etc.,

gurmukhi: swrMg sorT mwlisrI Aru rwmklI nt sMig imlwvY ]Bogn moh kI bwq ikqI suin kY mn jogn ky dÍ jwvY ]1544]
transliteration: Saaran Sorath Maalsiriar(u) Raamkalinat San(i) Milaavai|| Bhogad Moh Kibaat Kitisoun(i) Kai Man Jogad Ke Drav Jaavai||1544||
translation: They exhibited various kinds of gestures; they sang in the musical modes of Sarang, Sorath, Malvi, Ramkali, Nat etc.; seeing all this, let us not talk of the enjoyers, even the Yogis got attracted.1544.

gurmukhi: auq suMdr inrq krY nB mY ieq bIr sBY imil ju`Du krY ]brCI krvwr ktwrn isau jb hI mn mY Aiq kRu`D BrY ]
transliteration: Out Soundar Nirat Darai Nabh Mai It Beer Sabhai Mil(i) Juddh(u) Darai|| Barchhikarvaar Kataaran Sio Jab Himan Mai At(i) Kruddh Bdarai||
translation: On that side, in the sky, an elegant dance is going on; on this side, the warriors are engaged in war taking their lances, swords and daggers;

gurmukhi: kib sXwm AXoDn mY rdn`Cd pIs kY Awn prY n frY ]lir kY mir kY ju kbMD auTY Air kY su Ap`Cr qwih brY ]1545]
transliteration: Kabi Syaam Ayodhan Mai Rad-nachchhad Pees Kai Aan Darai Na Darai|| Lar(i) Kai Mar(i) Kai Ju Kabandh Outhai Ar(i) Kai Su Apachchhar Taah(i) Darai||1545||
translation: The poet says that these warriors have come to fight in the war-arena, fearlessly gnashing their teeth; those who die while fighting and the trunks that rise in the battlefield, the heavenly damsels are relating them.1545.

gurmukhi: bfo ju`Du BUpq kIE mn mY kop bFwie ]sB dyKn ko idn prY so kib khq sunwie ]1546]
transliteration: Bado Juddh(u) Bhoopat Keeo Man Mai Kop Badhaae|| Sabh Dekhan Ko Din Darai So Kabi Kahat Sounaae||1546||
translation: The king, in fury, waged a dreadful war and all the gods had to face extreme difficulties.1546.

gurmukhi: igAwrh rudRn ko sr bwies dÍwds Bwnn cauibis mwry ]ieMdR shMsR KVwnn ko Kt pwcis kwnH ko kop pHwry ]
transliteration: Giaarah Rudran Ko Sar Baais Dvaadas Bhaanan Chaoubis(i) Mdare|| Indra Sahansra Khadaanan Kjo Khat Paachas(i) Kaahn Ko Kop Prahdare||
translation: The king shot twenty-two arrows to the eleven Rudras and twenty-four to twelve Suryas; he shot one thousand arrows towards Indra, six to Kartikeya and twenty-five to Krishna;
